item.title: Ticket #1464 (wp-atom.php produces invalid enclosure) created
item.dc:creator: raster
item.description:
In wp-atom.php there is a call to rss_enclosure, so when an enclosure is added to a post, it outputs an enclosure element, which is invalid accoring to feedvalidator.org

Possible fix: A function like atom_enclosure could be added that would output either something like this: <content type="audio/mpeg" src="​http://foo.com/foo.mp3" /> or this: <link rel="related" type="audio/mpeg" href="​http://foo.com/foo.mp3" /> instead of RSS 2.0's enclosure element.

item.title: Ticket #1459 (texturize: characters that are substituted with entities adjacent to ...) updated
item.dc:creator: tjaard
item.description:
Summary, Milestone changed

Just found out that a sequence like (oh yeah...) gives problems too. Seems that it is a general problem that a character entity (or something that is replaced with one) adjacent to a parenthesis results in malformed xhtml.

item.title: Ticket #1463 (suggestion - 2 sites, same wordpress tables) updated
item.dc:creator: Anat

item.title: Ticket #1463 (suggestion - 2 sites, same wordpress tables) updated
item.dc:creator: Anat

item.title: Ticket #1463 (suggestion - 2 sites, same wordpress tables) created
item.dc:creator: Anat
item.description:
suggestion: can the blog address URI be stored in wp-config.php instead of in the tables, this way it shall be possible to run 2 different sites with the same tables, such that the sites can have the same content, see ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/20117

it also has another advantage if this suggestion is applied then users shifting their blogs to new sites will not face any problems regarding updating of blog addresses in the tables

item.title: Ticket #1462 (wp-register.php has an extra ")" on line 45 [PATCH]) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: The file wp-register has an extra ")" on line 45 causing a fatal error.

item.title: Ticket #1461 (get_settings('siteurl') links to wordpress URI and not blog URI) created
item.dc:creator: Anat
item.description:
If the URI for the wordpress address and URI for the blog address are different then '<?php echo get_settings('siteurl'); ?>' tag produces a link for the wordpress address and not for the blog address.

I assume that '<?php echo get_settings('siteurl'); ?>' tag just picks up the site url from the database and throws it on the webpage.

the '<?php echo get_settings('siteurl'); ?>' tag should be picking up the blog address from the database and not the wordpress location.

example: {I am using the default wordpress theme} My wordpress address: ​http://www.anat.moved.in/blog My blog address: ​http://www.anat.moved.in/ 1) goto ​http://www.anat.moved.in 2) from the right sidebar, select any archive month (say january 2005) 3) the archives for that month are displayed 4) now look at the right sidebar again and you shall see "You are currently browsing the meri lekhni weblog archives for January, 2005." {here "meri lekhni" is the name of my blog} 5) the hyperlink, when u click on "meri lekhni", is for "​http://www.anat.moved.in/blog" 6) but the link should have been for "​http://www.anat.moved.in" because this the blog address.

The wordpress directory URI is not the blog address so the "siteurl" php tag should not link to the wordpress URI.

item.title: Ticket #1460 (Need a post2cat entry for the about page post in install.php) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description:
Need to add this a post2cat record for the About page in wp-admin/install.php This should suffice: 

$wpdb->query( "INSERT INTO $wpdb->post2cat (`rel_id`, `post_id`, `category_id`) VALUES (2, 2, 1)" );

item.title: Ticket #1459 (texturize: characters that are substituted with entities adjacent to ...) created
item.dc:creator: tjaard
item.description: I made a post on my blog today, which contained the string ("word"). It after being texturized I got an xml parsing error (I serve my blog as xhtml+xml) because the result was malformed. The character entities for the quotes weren't properly delimited by a semicolon. Placing the (numerical) entities instead of the " character made no difference.

item.title: theme_switch_sidebar.patch attached to Ticket #1458
item.dc:creator: chrisdolan
item.description: Addition to themes/*/sidebar.php to add Theme Switcher support

item.title: Ticket #1458 (Add support for Theme Switcher plugin in the default templates) created
item.dc:creator: chrisdolan
item.description: The attached patch adds conditional sections the sidebar to show the available themes, via the Theme Switcher plugin. If that plugin is not active, the theme list is omitted.

item.title: Ticket #1457 (Add link to markdown syntax on post.php) updated
item.dc:creator: chrisdolan
item.description:
Oops, please ignore the patch in the first comment and consider the attached one. The pasted one omitted a necessary related patch to allow absolute URLs in the admin menus.

-- Chris

item.title: Ticket #1457 (Add link to markdown syntax on post.php) created
item.dc:creator: chrisdolan
item.description:
The patch below adds a "Markdown Syntax" link on the Write page if the Markdown plugin is active. The patch is against the Wordpress 1.5.1.2 svn tag. 

--- wp-admin/menu.php   (revision 2657)
+++ wp-admin/menu.php   (working copy)
@@ -18,6 +18,9 @@
 $submenu['post.php'][5] = array(__('Write Post'), 1, 'post.php');
 $submenu['post.php'][10] = array(__('Write Page'), 5, 'page-new.php');
+if (isset($MarkdownPHPVersion)) {
+       $submenu['post.php'][15] = array(__('Markdown Syntax'), 1, http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax');
+}
 $submenu['edit.php'][5] = array(__('Posts'), 1, 'edit.php');
 $submenu['edit.php'][10] = array(__('Pages'), 5, 'edit-pages.php');
